thread.title: IND vs SA, First ODI: AB de Villiers stars as Proteas clinch match by 5 runs
thread.title_full: IND vs SA, First ODI: AB de Villiers stars as Proteas clinch match by 5 runs

author: Deccan
title: IND vs SA, First ODI: AB de Villiers stars as Proteas clinch match by 5 runs
text:
Deccan Chronicle/PTI | October 11, 2015, 17.05 pm On the face of it, India appear to have a well-balanced side but it will have anything but easy against the South Africans, who are high on confidence after an emphatic T20 series win. (Photo: BCCI) Kanpur : Electing into bat, South Africa have posted 303 for five in the first one-day International against India here on Sunday. The Proteas also have become the first team to score more than 300 in Kanpur. Having been outplayed in the shortest format, there will be added pressure on captain Mahendra Singh Dhoni to perform.
(Photo: BCCI)
1st ODI. South Africa win the toss and elect to bat http://t.co/XOUhBdmazp #IndvsSA
— BCCI (@BCCI) October 11, 2015 It's time for Dhoni to answer his critics as more and more questions are being raised against his captaincy at a juncture where heir apparent and Test captain Virat Kohli is waiting in the wings.
Good luck Team India for the one day series. I am sure you will play to your potential and win the series. #IndvsSA
— VVS Laxman (@VVSLaxman281) October 11, 2015 Read: Kohli should lead in ODIs too: Ian Chappell
He enters his 'litmus test' having lost the T20 series and an unexpected loss in Bangladesh in June, after which he went out of action for three months.
Watch: Tough to play Rahane in current scenario, says MS Dhoni
On the face of it, India appear to have a well-balanced side but it will have anything but easy against the South Africans, who are high on confidence after an emphatic T20 series win. The tourists could not have asked for a better start to their long and arduous tour that culminates in December.
Here’s the playing XI
IND XI: S Dhawan, RG Sharma, V Kohli, A Rahane, S Raina, MS Dhoni, S Binny, R Ashwin, A Mishra, B Kumar, U Yadav
— BCCI (@BCCI) October 11, 2015 SA XI: H Amla, Q de Kock, F du Plessis, AB de Villiers, D Miller, JP Duminy, F Behardien, D Steyn, K Rabada, M Morkel, I Tahir
— BCCI (@BCCI) October 11, 2015 Here are the live updates
Live Score: IND 279-5 (47.3 overs)
SA 303-5 (50 overs)
WICKET! Morne Morkel traps Dhawan leg-before. The southpaw departs for 23.
WICKET! South Africa were looking dangerous, the Indian pacers not creating much of a problem for the visitors. But in came in Ravichandran Ashwin and struck in his first over itself sending Quinton de Kock for 29. A perfect off spin to a left-hander did the trick for the Chennai offie leaving Suresh Raina take a good low catch at slip.
The two captains, #ABdeVilliers and MS Dhoni along with Mr Rajeev Shukla and UP Governor Mr Ram Naik, released balloons in the sky today morning. #INDvsSA
Posted by Indian Cricket Team on Saturday, October 10, 2015 8.4: WICKET! Q de Kock (29) is out, c Suresh Raina b Ravichandran Ashwin, 45/1
— BCCI (@BCCI) October 11, 2015 WICKET! The faster one zipped crashed straight into Hashim Amla's woodwork leaving the South African opener stumped as he looked to play the ball on the leg-side. Amla added 37 runs to the scoreboard. Mishra weaves his magic to get Amla. 1st @Paytm ODI #IndvsSA https://t.co/og1teJlhWi
— BCCI (@BCCI) October 11, 2015 WICKET! Back for his second spell and what a start it was for Umesh Yadav, striking in the first ball itself trapping du Plessis, who completed his 17th ODI half-century, lbw. There was some reverse swing that worked for Yadav. Du Plessis departed for 62. 1st ODI. 33.1: WICKET! F du Plessis (62) is out, lbw Umesh Yadav, 152/3 http://t.co/XOUhBdmazp #IndvsSA
— BCCI (@BCCI) October 11, 2015 Meanwhile, while putting in a dive to field the ball off his own bowling, India's Ravichandran Ashwin has injured himself and has walked off the pitch. (Photo: BCCI) Read: Ravichandran Ashwin injury makes way for Harbhajan's inclusion in ODI squad WICKET! A sense of urgency was creeping among the South African batsmen, David Miller who went down the track missed it completely and Dhoni did the rest behind the stumps. Mishra claimed his second wicket of the match. Miller departed for 13 runs. 1st ODI. 40.3: WICKET! D Miller (13) is out, st MS Dhoni b Amit Mishra, 197/4 http://t.co/XOUhBdmazp #IndvsSA
— BCCI (@BCCI) October 11, 2015 WICKET! Umesh Yadav is doing the job for India, putting the brakes on the run scoring and has claimed yet another wicket of JP Duminy. Duminy, who has been dismissed for the first time on this tour, played a silly shot, with the ball kissing the edge of the bat leaving Dhoni with a simple catch. The Protea southpaw departed for 15 runs. 1st ODI. 45.1: WICKET! JP Duminy (15) is out, c MS Dhoni b Umesh Yadav, 238/5 http://t.co/XOUhBdmazp #IndvsSA
— BCCI (@BCCI) October 11, 2015 Tags: Cricket Team India South Africa MS Dhoni AB de Villiers Ravichandran Ashwin JP Duminy Kanpur Also Read 5 talking points ahead of India-South Africa ODIs You don't want MS Dhoni to become a liability for the team: Ajit Agarkar We shouldn't get too cocky, India are a quality side: Russell Domingo Video: MS Dhoni reveals his plans to make changes in India’s batting line-up
